page.title: 07 EMPLOYMENT 2
page.content: Sark roads are repaired by a workforce of six island workmen. The stone is dug out and crushed, taken up the hill by tractor, tipped onto the road, levelled and rolled out flat. Near Christmas many men go to England to cut down Christmas Trees. Many Sark women knit Guernsey sweaters. Sark cream also provides employment for several people. This is made by separating the rich milk left over from domestic supplies. The cream turns and is churned into deep yellow Sark butter which is packed and sold or used in the home.
